subject: Re: [junit] Re: Randomly Ordered Repeating Test Suite
msgSnippet: ... You hear this.  But my experience is that some people just like to use debuggers and some people can t stand them. ... Myself, I am in the
messageBody:
On Wed, 17 Dec 2003, Chad Woolley wrote:

> I know that many people on this list (and Dave Astel's in his fine book)
> say you shouldn't need the debugger if you TDD intensively enough. I

You hear this. But my experience is that some people just like to use
debuggers and some people can't stand them.

> myself am unfortunately not to that level yet, and I often find it
> useful to fire up the debugger.

Myself, I am in the can't-stand-debuggers camp. But it's always nice to
have one of those debugger-lovers around when you just can't figure out
what the problem is. ;-)

> Whatever approach you use, I think the general idea is to gradually
> narrow down the scope of the unknown failure until you can see what is
> the root cause.

--
